intro: Ardisia maasolae, commonly known as the Maasolae beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
